text:
The way up and the way down are one and the same.
No man ever steps in the same river twice, for it's not the same river and he's not the same man.
This world, which is the same for all, no one of gods or men has made. But it always was, is, and will be: an ever-living Fire, with measures of it kindling, and measures going out.
War is the father of all and the king of all; and some he has made gods and some men, some bond and some free.
Everything flows and nothing stands still.
Men do not understand how that which is torn in different directions comes into accord with itself - harmony in contrariety, as in the case of the bow and the lyre.
Listening not to me but to the Logos it is wise to agree that all things are one.
The waking have one common world, but the sleeping turn aside each into a world of his own.
Nature loves to hide.
Eyes and ears are poor witnesses for men if they have barbarian souls.
Immortals are mortals, mortals immortals, living their death, dying their life.
Time is a game played beautifully by children.
If you do not expect the unexpected, you will not find it; for it is hard to be sought out and difficult.
Man is kindled and put out like a light in the night.
Dogs bark at what they do not know.
